author: ScopionSniper
text:
The world is always like this though. Every generation goes through very similar patterns.

Pandemic is new though. But even now people are starting to care less and less as cases climb and the death rate falls. Becoming integrated and no longer head turning. Death rate is too low to really get many scared in the US. Sad tbh.

author: [deleted]
text:
> Pandemic is new though.

We haven't had one at this scale since the 50s, sure. But they're not new. HIV was a scary thing in the 80s.

author: ScopionSniper
text:
At the same time, HIV is a much scarier disease from the standpoint of the average person who got it back in the 80s, compared to the average person who gets Covid19, as long as your not immunocompromised or elderly.

So I kinda see his point there.
